byline.contributor: Ahmad Shakib and Jawad Sukhanyar contributed reporting from Kabul, and an employee of The New York Times from Baghlan Province, Afghanistan.

abstract: Afghan forces battling Taliban for control of Kunduz, Afghanistan, get closer to retaking city, as United States tries to explain airstrike that destroyed crucial hospital there; reports of new fighting indicate that a second provincial capital is under attack.
lead_paragraph: Residents began to emerge in those parts of the city under government control, amid new reports of another provincial city coming under Taliban attack.

headline.main: Afghan Forces Report Progress in Kunduz as Taliban Press Other Fronts
headline.print_headline: Afghan Forces Report Progress in Kunduz as Taliban Press Other Fronts

snippet: Residents began to emerge in those parts of the city under government control, amid new reports of another provincial city coming under Taliban attack.
